title: 5 Ways to Improve the Sustainability of Electronics - Electronic Design
summary: The article discusses the challenges the electronics industry faces in creating more sustainable products, highlighting the need for circularity and sustainable practices throughout the product lifecycle. It explores initiatives such as the European Commission's Sustainable Products Initiative, emphasizing the transition to a circular economy for sustainable growth and job creation. The article also outlines key areas for improvement in flexible electronics sustainability, including circular design, sustainable raw material choices, energy-efficient manufacturing techniques, and end-of-life management for the circular economy.
company: VTT Technical Research Centre of Finland
official_company_name: VTT Technical Research Centre of Finland
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 541710 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences, 334413 - Semiconductor and Related Device Manufacturing, 334419 - Other Electronic Component Manufacturing, 541715 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences (except Nanotechnology and Biotechnology)

title: Sunshine Coast's new recycling plant now open - Council - Council Magazine
summary: The article discusses the opening of the Nambour Material Recovery Facility, a high-tech facility capable of sorting paper and cardboard at a purity rate of 98%. The facility is funded through agreements between different levels of government and aims to process recyclable products for re-use, contributing to the circular economy and reducing waste to landfill.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities, 562998 - All Other Miscellaneous Waste Management Services, 562111 - Solid Waste Collection, 237130 - Power and Communication Line and Related Structures Construction

title: Getting it sorted: meet MuRF, our recycling wonder - OurSC
summary: A new recycling plant called MuRF has opened on the Sunshine Coast, sorting household and business recyclable waste. The plant uses advanced screening and sorting equipment to recover various materials for recycling, creating new products and promoting sustainability in the region.
green_innovation: TRUE, The MuRF recycling plant represents a green innovation as it contributes to environmental sustainability goals by reducing waste, conserving resources, and promoting recycling.
business_innovation: TRUE, The MuRF recycling plant can be considered a business innovation as it introduces a new process for sorting and recovering recyclable materials efficiently.
green_product: TRUE, The MuRF recycling plant aligns with the definition of a green product as it is designed to significantly reduce environmental impact through sustainable practices in waste management and resource recovery.
green_process: TRUE, The MuRF recycling plant's sorting and recycling processes adhere to green principles by minimizing environmental impacts, reducing waste, and promoting sustainability in material recovery.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities, 562998 - All Other Miscellaneous Waste Management Services, 221320 - Sewage Treatment Facilities, 562112 - Hazardous Waste Treatment and Disposal
